headline.main: WAR ZONE REPEAL FACES TEST TODAY; Pepper to Propose Committee Amend Ship Arms Bill to Give Freedom of Seas

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 24 -- The movement for outright repeal of all important restrictive provisions of the Neutrality Act, as precipitated by a combination of "Willkie Republicans" and New Deal Democrats, will receive its first test tomorrow when the Senate Foreign Relations Committee passes on the House-approved resolution to remove the ban against arming American merchant ships.
